tasks.title: Setup Project Repository
tasks.description: Initialize the project repository with appropriate structure and dependencies.
tasks.details: Create a new Git repository. Set up the project structure with separate folders for frontend, backend, and configuration files. Initialize package.json for both frontend and backend. Install necessary dependencies such as TanStack, Tailwind, and Convex.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that the repository is correctly initialized and all dependencies are installed without errors.

subtasks.title: Create and Initialize Git Repository
subtasks.description: Create a new Git repository and perform the initial commit.
subtasks.details: Use Git to initialize a new repository in the project root. Add a README.md file to document the project and a .gitignore file to exclude unnecessary files from version control.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that the repository is initialized, README.md and .gitignore are present, and the initial commit is successful.

subtasks.title: Establish Project Directory Structure
subtasks.description: Set up the directory structure with separate folders for frontend, backend, and configuration files.
subtasks.details: Create 'frontend', 'backend', and 'config' directories. Ensure each directory is empty or contains placeholder files as needed for initialization.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check that the directory structure matches the specification and all folders are tracked in the repository.

subtasks.title: Initialize Package Managers
subtasks.description: Initialize package.json files for both frontend and backend directories.
subtasks.details: Run 'npm init -y' or equivalent in both the frontend and backend directories to generate package.json files.
subtasks.testStrategy: Confirm that package.json exists in both directories and contains default values.

subtasks.title: Install Core Dependencies
subtasks.description: Install required dependencies such as TanStack, Tailwind, and Convex in the appropriate directories.
subtasks.details: Use npm or yarn to install TanStack and Tailwind in the frontend, and Convex in the backend. Update package.json and lock files accordingly.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that all dependencies are listed in package.json and can be imported without errors.

subtasks.title: Configure Repository Security and Best Practices
subtasks.description: Apply repository best practices including branch protection, security scanning, and documentation.
subtasks.details: Enable branch protection rules, set up Dependabot alerts, add SECURITY.md, and ensure sensitive files are excluded via .gitignore.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check that security features are enabled, documentation files are present, and no sensitive files are tracked.

tasks.title: Configure ElevenLabs Assistant
tasks.description: Set up the ElevenLabs assistant with the required configuration for the MVP.
tasks.details:
Use the ElevenLabs Dashboard to create an assistant using the Blank template. Configure the system prompt, voice, analysis, data collection, and knowledge base as per the PRD. Ensure the assistant is capable of conducting a 30-minute phone screen with dynamic probing and topic rotation.
<info added on 2025-08-07T22:02:28.920Z>
Incorporate Polar payments and minute-based credits as per the updated PRD. Add dependencies to the backend schema/APIs for managing credits and transactions, and update the frontend UI to display user balance and implement gating based on available credits.
</info added on 2025-08-07T22:02:28.920Z>
tasks.testStrategy: Conduct a test session to ensure the assistant follows the configured structure and rules.

subtasks.title: Create Assistant Using Blank Template
subtasks.description: Use the ElevenLabs Dashboard to create a new assistant instance starting from the Blank template.
subtasks.details: Access the ElevenLabs Dashboard, select 'Create Assistant', and choose the Blank template as the starting point for configuration.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that a new assistant instance is created and accessible in the dashboard.

subtasks.title: Configure System Prompt and Voice
subtasks.description: Set up the system prompt and select the appropriate voice according to the PRD requirements.
subtasks.details: Edit the assistant's system prompt to match the PRD. Choose a voice from ElevenLabs' options that aligns with the assistant's intended tone and clarity.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test the assistant's initial responses and voice output to ensure they match the desired prompt and vocal characteristics.

subtasks.title: Set Up Analysis and Data Collection Parameters
subtasks.description: Configure how the assistant analyzes conversations and collects data, ensuring compliance with the PRD.
subtasks.details: Define analysis rules (e.g., dynamic probing, topic rotation) and specify what data is collected during sessions, such as transcripts and metadata.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run a simulated session and confirm that analysis features and data collection operate as specified.

subtasks.title: Integrate and Populate Knowledge Base
subtasks.description: Connect and upload relevant knowledge base content as outlined in the PRD.
subtasks.details: Upload documents, embeddings, or structured data to the assistant's knowledge base to support dynamic conversation and topic rotation.
subtasks.testStrategy: Query the assistant with knowledge-based questions and verify accurate, context-aware responses.

subtasks.title: Validate 30-Minute Phone Screen Capability
subtasks.description: Ensure the assistant can conduct a 30-minute phone screen with dynamic probing and topic rotation.
subtasks.details: Simulate a full-length phone screen session, monitoring for adherence to timing, dynamic probing, and topic rotation as per the PRD.
subtasks.testStrategy: Conduct a test session and review logs to confirm the assistant maintains structure, adapts topics, and completes the session within the required timeframe.

tasks.title: Design Backend Schema and APIs
tasks.description: Design the database schema and implement the necessary APIs for session management.
tasks.details: Define the data models for users, sessions, transcripts, evaluations, and question_sets. Implement the Convex APIs: createSession, endSession, saveTranscript, saveEvaluation, listSessions, and getSessionSummary.
tasks.testStrategy: Write unit tests for each API to ensure they perform CRUD operations correctly and handle edge cases.

subtasks.title: Define Data Models for Core Entities
subtasks.description: Design and document the database schema for users, sessions, transcripts, evaluations, and question_sets, ensuring all necessary fields and relationships are specified.
subtasks.details: Create Convex schema definitions for each entity, including indexes and relationships (e.g., sessions linked to users, transcripts linked to sessions). Consider requirements for anonymous and authenticated users.
subtasks.testStrategy: Validate schema by creating and querying sample records for each entity, ensuring referential integrity and correct indexing.

subtasks.title: Implement Session Management APIs
subtasks.description: Develop Convex APIs for creating, ending, and listing sessions, handling both authenticated and anonymous users.
subtasks.details: Implement createSession, endSession, and listSessions functions. Ensure session IDs are generated, tracked, and associated with user or anonymous identifiers as appropriate.
subtasks.testStrategy: Write unit tests to verify session creation, termination, and retrieval, including edge cases for duplicate or invalid sessions.

subtasks.title: Develop Transcript and Evaluation APIs
subtasks.description: Create APIs to save transcripts and evaluations, associating them with the correct session and user records.
subtasks.details: Implement saveTranscript and saveEvaluation functions, ensuring data is validated and linked to the appropriate session. Support optional metadata such as timing and topic tags.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test saving and retrieving transcripts and evaluations, including handling of missing or malformed data.

subtasks.title: Implement Session Summary Retrieval API
subtasks.description: Develop the getSessionSummary API to aggregate and return session details, including transcripts and evaluations.
subtasks.details: Design the API to efficiently fetch and format all relevant data for a session summary, supporting frontend requirements for detailed session views.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test summary retrieval for sessions with varying data completeness, ensuring correct aggregation and error handling.

subtasks.title: Write Comprehensive Unit Tests for All APIs
subtasks.description: Develop and execute unit tests for each API to ensure correct CRUD operations, data validation, and error handling.
subtasks.details: Cover normal and edge cases, including invalid input, missing data, and concurrent operations. Ensure tests are automated and reproducible.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run all tests and verify 100% pass rate. Review test coverage to confirm all API endpoints and major logic branches are exercised.

tasks.title: Implement Frontend Routes and UI
tasks.description: Develop the frontend routes and user interface for session configuration and management.
tasks.details: Use TanStack Start and Router to create routes: '/', '/session', and '/summary/$id'. Implement the UI using Shadcn UI and Tailwind for layout and components. Ensure the UI is mobile-first and accessible.
tasks.testStrategy: Perform end-to-end testing to ensure navigation between routes works as expected and the UI is responsive.

subtasks.title: Set Up TanStack Start Project Structure
subtasks.description: Initialize the project structure required for TanStack Start, including the routes, router, and configuration files.
subtasks.details: Create the necessary folders and files such as app/routes, app/router.tsx, and app.config.ts. Ensure the project is ready for route and UI implementation.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that the project builds successfully and the initial route renders without errors.

subtasks.title: Define Frontend Routes Using TanStack Router
subtasks.description: Implement the routes '/', '/session', and '/summary/$id' using TanStack Router within the project.
subtasks.details:
Configure the route tree and ensure each route points to the correct component. Use file-based or code-based routing as appropriate.
<info added on 2025-08-08T09:03:05.962Z>
Implementation progress: Added stub routes using TanStack Router. Updated the `/` route to a dashboard scaffold using `@syntaxia/ui` Button and Clerk components. Added a new `/session` route with placeholders, gated by `convex/react` Authenticated/Unauthenticated wrappers. Added a new `/summary/$id` route with parameter rendering and placeholder content. Ensured layout and CSS via `@syntaxia/ui/globals.css` and applied a mono font brutalist theme. Next steps include filling content for session live UI and wiring real data for the summary route.
</info added on 2025-08-08T09:03:05.962Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Navigate to each route and confirm the correct component renders for '/', '/session', and '/summary/$id'.

subtasks.title: Develop UI Components with Shadcn UI and Tailwind
subtasks.description: Build the user interface components for session configuration, management, and summary views using Shadcn UI and Tailwind CSS.
subtasks.details: Design and implement reusable components for forms, lists, and summaries. Apply Tailwind classes for layout and styling.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check that all UI components render correctly and match the design specifications across all routes.

subtasks.title: Ensure Mobile-First and Accessible Design
subtasks.description: Adapt the UI to be mobile-first and accessible, following best practices for responsive design and accessibility.
subtasks.details: Use Tailwind's responsive utilities and Shadcn UI's accessibility features. Test with screen readers and keyboard navigation.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test the UI on various device sizes and with accessibility tools to confirm responsiveness and accessibility compliance.

subtasks.title: Implement and Validate Route Navigation and UI Integration
subtasks.description: Integrate the routes and UI components, ensuring seamless navigation and state management between views.
subtasks.details: Wire up navigation between routes, manage session state, and ensure data flows correctly between components.
subtasks.testStrategy: Perform end-to-end testing to verify navigation, UI responsiveness, and correct data handling across all routes.

tasks.title: Integrate ElevenLabs Web SDK
tasks.description: Integrate the ElevenLabs Web SDK for real-time audio interaction during sessions.
tasks.details: Embed the ElevenLabs Web SDK into the '/session' route to enable low-latency two-way audio. Ensure the SDK is configured to handle dynamic probing and topic rotation.
tasks.testStrategy: Conduct a live session to verify real-time audio interaction works seamlessly with low latency.

subtasks.title: Install and Configure ElevenLabs Web SDK
subtasks.description: Add the ElevenLabs Web SDK to the project and configure it with the required API keys and environment variables.
subtasks.details: Follow official ElevenLabs documentation to install the SDK via npm or yarn. Set up environment variables for API authentication and ensure the SDK is ready for use in the frontend application.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify the SDK loads without errors and can authenticate using the provided API key.

subtasks.title: Embed SDK in '/session' Route UI
subtasks.description: Integrate the ElevenLabs Web SDK components into the '/session' route to enable real-time audio interaction.
subtasks.details: Modify the '/session' route to include the SDKâ€™s UI components or hooks, ensuring microphone access and audio playback are enabled for two-way communication.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check that users can start and stop audio sessions and that audio streams are transmitted in real time.

subtasks.title: Implement Dynamic Probing and Topic Rotation Logic
subtasks.description: Configure the SDK and session logic to support dynamic probing and automatic topic rotation during live sessions.
subtasks.details: Integrate logic that triggers probing questions and rotates topics based on session flow, leveraging SDK APIs or custom logic as needed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Simulate sessions to confirm that probing and topic changes occur dynamically and as intended.

subtasks.title: Optimize for Low-Latency Two-Way Audio
subtasks.description: Tune SDK and network settings to minimize audio latency and ensure seamless two-way interaction.
subtasks.details: Adjust SDK configuration and browser audio settings to reduce round-trip latency. Test on various networks and devices to ensure consistent low-latency performance.
subtasks.testStrategy: Measure end-to-end audio latency during test sessions and confirm it meets real-time interaction requirements.

subtasks.title: Conduct End-to-End Live Session Testing
subtasks.description: Run comprehensive live session tests to validate real-time audio, dynamic probing, topic rotation, and overall user experience.
subtasks.details: Perform live walkthroughs of the '/session' route with multiple users, capturing feedback and identifying any integration or UX issues.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that all features work seamlessly together and that the session experience meets project requirements.

tasks.title: Implement Transcript Capture and Storage
tasks.description: Capture and store session transcripts for analysis and feedback.
tasks.details: Develop functionality to capture real-time transcripts during sessions. Store transcripts in the database with session metadata. Ensure transcripts include roles, text, and optional timing and topic tags.
tasks.testStrategy: Simulate a session and verify that transcripts are accurately captured and stored in the database.

subtasks.title: Integrate Real-Time Transcription Service
subtasks.description: Set up and configure a real-time transcription service (e.g., OpenAI, AWS Transcribe, Azure, or similar) to capture audio streams and convert them to text during live sessions.
subtasks.details: Research and select a suitable transcription API. Implement audio streaming from the client to the backend and connect to the chosen transcription provider using WebSockets or equivalent protocols.
subtasks.testStrategy: Simulate a session with live audio input and verify that the transcription service returns accurate, real-time text output.

subtasks.title: Parse and Structure Transcript Data
subtasks.description: Process the raw transcription output to extract and structure transcript entries, including speaker roles, text, and optional timing and topic tags.
subtasks.details: Implement logic to segment the transcript by speaker turns, assign roles, and attach timestamps and topic tags where available.
subtasks.testStrategy: Feed sample transcription data and verify that the output includes correctly structured entries with all required metadata.

subtasks.title: Design and Implement Transcript Storage Schema
subtasks.description: Define and create the database schema for storing transcripts along with session metadata, ensuring scalability and efficient retrieval.
subtasks.details: Extend the backend data model to include transcript records linked to session IDs, with fields for roles, text, timestamps, topic tags, and any relevant metadata.
subtasks.testStrategy: Insert sample structured transcripts and confirm they are stored and retrievable with all associated metadata.

subtasks.title: Implement Transcript Capture and Save Logic
subtasks.description: Develop backend logic to capture structured transcript data in real time and persist it to the database as the session progresses.
subtasks.details: Ensure transcript entries are saved incrementally or in batches during the session, with robust error handling and data integrity checks.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run a simulated session, verify that transcripts are saved in real time, and check for completeness and consistency in the database.

subtasks.title: Validate and Review Transcript Storage and Retrieval
subtasks.description: Test the end-to-end process by simulating sessions, reviewing stored transcripts, and ensuring all required data (roles, text, timing, topic tags) is accurately captured and accessible for analysis and feedback.
subtasks.details: Perform comprehensive testing, including edge cases (e.g., rapid speaker changes, missing metadata), and review transcripts for accuracy and completeness.
subtasks.testStrategy: Simulate multiple session scenarios, retrieve stored transcripts, and verify that all fields are present and correct for analysis and feedback workflows.

tasks.title: Develop Evaluation Ingestion and Persistence
tasks.description: Implement the ingestion and storage of evaluation data post-session.
tasks.details: Create functionality to receive evaluation payloads via webhook or SDK events. Store evaluations in the database with associated session data. Ensure evaluations include rubric scores, decisions, and metrics.
tasks.testStrategy: Test the evaluation ingestion process with mock payloads to ensure data is correctly stored and retrievable.

subtasks.title: Design Evaluation Payload Schema and Validation Rules
subtasks.description: Define the structure and required fields for evaluation payloads, including rubric scores, decisions, and metrics. Establish validation rules to ensure data quality and completeness before ingestion.
subtasks.details: Document the expected schema for evaluation data and implement validation logic to check format, completeness, and business logic at the earliest stage.
subtasks.testStrategy: Create unit tests to verify that only valid payloads are accepted and invalid payloads are rejected with appropriate error messages.

subtasks.title: Implement Webhook and SDK Event Handlers for Ingestion
subtasks.description: Develop endpoints and event listeners to receive evaluation payloads via webhooks and SDK events post-session.
subtasks.details: Set up secure and scalable handlers to capture incoming evaluation data from external sources, ensuring support for both webhook and SDK-based ingestion.
subtasks.testStrategy: Simulate webhook and SDK event calls with mock payloads to confirm successful receipt and initial processing.

subtasks.title: Transform and Enrich Evaluation Data
subtasks.description: Process incoming evaluation payloads to standardize formats, enrich with session metadata, and prepare for storage.
subtasks.details: Apply necessary transformations such as data type normalization, schema mapping, and enrichment with session identifiers or timestamps.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test transformation logic with diverse payloads to ensure correct mapping and enrichment of all required fields.

subtasks.title: Persist Evaluation Data with Session Association
subtasks.description: Store validated and transformed evaluation data in the database, ensuring each record is linked to the correct session.
subtasks.details: Implement database operations to insert evaluation records, maintaining referential integrity with session data and supporting efficient retrieval.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that evaluations are correctly stored and associated with sessions by querying the database after ingestion.

subtasks.title: Monitor, Audit, and Handle Ingestion Failures
subtasks.description: Establish monitoring, logging, and error handling for the ingestion pipeline to detect, alert, and recover from failures.
subtasks.details: Set up real-time monitoring dashboards, automated alerts for ingestion errors, and audit logs for traceability. Implement retry and fallback mechanisms for failed ingestions.
subtasks.testStrategy: Induce ingestion errors and verify that failures are logged, alerts are triggered, and recovery mechanisms function as intended.

tasks.title: Create Summary Page Rendering
tasks.description: Develop the summary page to display post-call evaluation and feedback.
tasks.details: Implement the '/summary/$id' route to render the post-call summary. Display rubric scores, evidence snippets, top gaps, and suggested study links. Ensure the summary is clear and actionable.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify the summary page displays all required information correctly and is accessible.

subtasks.title: Design Summary Page Layout
subtasks.description: Create a clear and actionable layout for the summary page that organizes rubric scores, evidence snippets, top gaps, and suggested study links.
subtasks.details: Define the visual structure and user flow for the summary page, ensuring each required element is prominently and intuitively displayed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Review wireframes or mockups with stakeholders to confirm clarity and completeness of all required sections.

subtasks.title: Implement '/summary/$id' Route and Data Fetching
subtasks.description: Develop the backend and frontend logic to handle the '/summary/$id' route and retrieve the relevant post-call evaluation data.
subtasks.details: Set up routing and ensure the page loads the correct summary data based on the session ID, integrating with backend APIs as needed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test navigation to various summary pages and verify correct data is loaded for each session.

subtasks.title: Render Rubric Scores and Evidence Snippets
subtasks.description: Display rubric scores and supporting evidence snippets for the evaluated call in a user-friendly format.
subtasks.details: Map rubric scores and evidence data to visual components, ensuring scores are easily interpretable and evidence is clearly linked.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify rubric scores and evidence snippets are displayed accurately and are visually distinct.

subtasks.title: Highlight Top Gaps and Suggested Study Links
subtasks.description: Identify and present the most significant performance gaps and provide actionable study resources or links.
subtasks.details: Analyze evaluation data to determine top gaps, then display them alongside curated or dynamically generated study links.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check that top gaps are correctly identified and that all suggested study links are relevant and functional.

subtasks.title: Ensure Accessibility and Actionability
subtasks.description: Review and enhance the summary page for accessibility compliance and actionable feedback presentation.
subtasks.details: Apply accessibility best practices (e.g., ARIA roles, keyboard navigation) and ensure feedback is clear, concise, and actionable for users.
subtasks.testStrategy: Conduct accessibility audits and user testing to confirm the page is usable by all and feedback is easily understood.

tasks.title: Implement Session History Feature
tasks.description: Develop functionality to view and manage past sessions and summaries.
tasks.details: Create a session history page that lists past sessions with filters. Allow users to view detailed summaries and retake sessions with the same settings.
tasks.testStrategy: Test the session history page to ensure it lists sessions correctly and allows navigation to detailed summaries.

subtasks.title: Design Session History Data Model
subtasks.description: Define the data structures required to store session metadata, summaries, and filters for the session history feature.
subtasks.details: Specify fields such as session ID, user ID, timestamps, session settings, summary data, and any filterable attributes. Ensure compatibility with existing session and transcript schemas.
subtasks.testStrategy: Review the data model for completeness and validate with sample data to ensure all required information for history and filtering is captured.

subtasks.title: Implement Backend APIs for Session History
subtasks.description: Develop backend endpoints to list, filter, and retrieve detailed session summaries, and to initiate a new session with previous settings.
subtasks.details: Create APIs for listing sessions with filters (date, user, etc.), fetching session details, and cloning session settings for retake functionality.
subtasks.testStrategy: Write unit and integration tests to verify correct data retrieval, filtering, and retake session initialization.

subtasks.title: Develop Session History Page UI
subtasks.description: Build the frontend page to display a list of past sessions with filtering options and navigation to session details.
subtasks.details: Use the defined data model and APIs to render session lists, implement filter controls, and ensure responsive, accessible design.
subtasks.testStrategy: Perform UI tests to confirm sessions are listed, filters work, and navigation to details is functional on all supported devices.

subtasks.title: Implement Session Summary View and Retake Action
subtasks.description: Enable users to view detailed session summaries and provide a mechanism to retake sessions with the same settings.
subtasks.details: Display all relevant summary data and include a 'Retake Session' button that pre-fills the session configuration with previous settings.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test summary rendering for various session types and verify that retake action correctly initializes a new session with matching settings.

subtasks.title: End-to-End Testing and Validation
subtasks.description: Conduct comprehensive testing of the session history feature, including listing, filtering, summary viewing, and retake functionality.
subtasks.details: Simulate user workflows to ensure all components interact correctly and the feature meets requirements for usability and reliability.
subtasks.testStrategy: Execute end-to-end tests covering all user scenarios and edge cases, and address any identified issues before release.

tasks.title: Configure Privacy and Security Measures
tasks.description: Implement privacy and security measures for session data.
tasks.details: Ensure transcripts and evaluations are stored securely and can be deleted on request. Display a notice about session recording. Implement rate limiting and session duration caps.
tasks.testStrategy: Conduct security testing to verify data protection measures and compliance with privacy requirements.

subtasks.title: Implement Secure Storage for Session Data
subtasks.description: Ensure all transcripts and evaluations are stored using secure, encrypted storage mechanisms to protect sensitive session data from unauthorized access.
subtasks.details: Use strong encryption algorithms for data at rest and restrict access to authorized personnel or services only. Regularly audit storage access logs.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify encryption is applied to stored data and attempt unauthorized access to confirm protections are effective.

subtasks.title: Enable Data Deletion on User Request
subtasks.description: Provide functionality for users to request deletion of their transcripts and evaluations, ensuring compliance with privacy regulations.
subtasks.details: Implement a user interface and backend API to handle deletion requests, and ensure all related data is permanently removed from storage and backups.
subtasks.testStrategy: Submit deletion requests and confirm that all associated data is irretrievable from both primary and backup storage.

subtasks.title: Display Session Recording Notice
subtasks.description: Clearly inform users that their session is being recorded and data will be stored, in compliance with transparency and consent requirements.
subtasks.details: Add a prominent notice or modal at session start, requiring user acknowledgment before proceeding.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check that the notice is displayed before session initiation and that user acknowledgment is logged.

subtasks.title: Implement Rate Limiting and Session Duration Caps
subtasks.description: Set and enforce limits on the number of requests per user and maximum session duration to prevent abuse and reduce security risks.
subtasks.details: Configure backend to reject requests exceeding rate limits and automatically terminate sessions that exceed the allowed duration.
subtasks.testStrategy: Simulate excessive requests and prolonged sessions to verify that limits are enforced and appropriate errors or terminations occur.

subtasks.title: Enforce Secure Session Management Practices
subtasks.description: Apply best practices for session management, including secure session ID generation, HTTPS enforcement, session expiration, and proper logout mechanisms.
subtasks.details: Use cryptographically secure random session IDs, ensure all session data is transmitted over HTTPS, set reasonable session timeouts, and provide clear logout functionality.
subtasks.testStrategy: Review session ID properties, test session expiration and logout, and verify all session traffic is encrypted.

tasks.title: Setup Testing and CI/CD Pipeline
tasks.description: Establish a testing framework and continuous integration/deployment pipeline.
tasks.details: Set up Jest for testing and configure a CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions. Ensure tests are run on every commit and deployment is automated for both frontend and backend.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that the CI/CD pipeline triggers on commits and all tests pass successfully before deployment.

subtasks.title: Install and Configure Jest for Frontend and Backend
subtasks.description: Set up Jest as the testing framework for both frontend and backend codebases, ensuring all necessary dependencies and configuration files are in place.
subtasks.details: Install Jest and related libraries (such as @testing-library/react for frontend and any backend-specific adapters). Create or update jest.config.js files for both codebases and verify integration with the project structure.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 'jest --version' and execute a sample test in both frontend and backend to confirm setup.

subtasks.title: Write and Organize Initial Test Suites
subtasks.description: Develop initial unit and integration tests for critical frontend and backend components, and establish a directory structure for ongoing test development.
subtasks.details: Create test directories and write sample tests covering key modules and endpoints. Ensure tests are discoverable by Jest and follow best practices for maintainability.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run all tests locally and verify that they pass and provide meaningful coverage reports.

subtasks.title: Configure GitHub Actions for CI Pipeline
subtasks.description: Set up GitHub Actions workflows to automatically run tests on every commit and pull request for both frontend and backend.
subtasks.details: Create .github/workflows YAML files specifying jobs for installing dependencies, running Jest tests, and reporting results. Ensure the workflow triggers on push and pull_request events.
subtasks.testStrategy: Push a test commit and confirm that the CI pipeline runs and reports test results in the GitHub interface.

subtasks.title: Automate Deployment for Frontend and Backend
subtasks.description: Extend the CI pipeline to include automated deployment steps for both frontend and backend upon successful test completion.
subtasks.details: Add deployment jobs to the GitHub Actions workflows, integrating with hosting services (e.g., Vercel, Netlify, AWS, or custom servers) and ensuring environment variables and secrets are securely managed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Trigger a deployment via a commit and verify that both frontend and backend are updated in their respective environments.

subtasks.title: Enforce Pre-Deployment Test Gates
subtasks.description: Ensure that deployments are only triggered if all tests pass, preventing faulty code from reaching production.
subtasks.details: Configure the CI/CD workflow to halt deployment steps if any test fails, and set up branch protection rules if necessary.
subtasks.testStrategy: Intentionally introduce a failing test, push a commit, and verify that deployment does not proceed until the issue is resolved.

tasks.title: Conduct User Acceptance Testing (UAT)
tasks.description: Perform user acceptance testing to validate the application against requirements.
tasks.details: Organize UAT sessions with stakeholders to test the application in real-world scenarios. Collect feedback and identify any issues or improvements needed.
tasks.testStrategy: Document UAT findings and ensure all critical issues are resolved before release.

subtasks.title: Define UAT Scope and Objectives
subtasks.description: Establish the scope, objectives, and success criteria for user acceptance testing based on business requirements and project documentation.
subtasks.details: Review requirements and user stories to clarify what needs to be validated during UAT. Document the scope, objectives, and entry/exit criteria for the testing phase.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that all requirements and objectives are clearly documented and agreed upon by stakeholders before proceeding.

subtasks.title: Design UAT Test Cases and Scenarios
subtasks.description: Develop detailed test cases and real-world scenarios that reflect user requirements and expected workflows.
subtasks.details: Create specific, measurable test cases for each feature or process to be validated. Ensure scenarios simulate realistic user interactions and cover critical functionality.
subtasks.testStrategy: Review test cases with stakeholders to confirm coverage and clarity; ensure each test case has clear pass/fail criteria.

subtasks.title: Prepare UAT Environment and Data
subtasks.description: Set up a dedicated UAT environment that closely mirrors production, including necessary hardware, software, and test data.
subtasks.details: Configure the environment to match production settings and load representative data sets to enable accurate testing.
subtasks.testStrategy: Validate that the environment is stable and accessible to all testers, and that test data supports all planned scenarios.

subtasks.title: Execute UAT Sessions with Stakeholders
subtasks.description: Coordinate and conduct UAT sessions, guiding stakeholders through test cases and capturing feedback, issues, and improvement suggestions.
subtasks.details: Facilitate testing sessions, provide instructions, and ensure all scenarios are executed. Record defects, usability concerns, and enhancement requests.
subtasks.testStrategy: Track completion of all test cases and document all findings in a centralized tracking tool.

subtasks.title: Document Results and Manage Sign-Off
subtasks.description: Compile UAT findings, track issue resolution, and obtain formal sign-off from stakeholders upon successful completion.
subtasks.details: Summarize test results, prioritize and assign issues for resolution, and confirm that all critical items are addressed. Prepare a sign-off document for stakeholder approval.
subtasks.testStrategy: Ensure all critical issues are resolved and acceptance criteria are met before obtaining stakeholder sign-off.

tasks.title: Optimize Performance and Latency
tasks.description: Improve application performance and reduce latency for a better user experience.
tasks.details: Analyze performance bottlenecks and optimize code and configurations. Focus on reducing audio latency and improving response times.
tasks.testStrategy: Conduct performance testing to measure improvements and ensure latency is within acceptable limits.

subtasks.title: Identify and Analyze Performance Bottlenecks
subtasks.description: Profile the application to detect areas causing high latency or slow performance, with a focus on audio processing and response times.
subtasks.details: Use profiling tools and performance monitoring to gather metrics on CPU, memory, network, and audio processing. Document the most significant bottlenecks affecting user experience.
subtasks.testStrategy: Establish baseline performance metrics and verify that bottlenecks are reproducible and measurable.

subtasks.title: Optimize Code and Resource Loading
subtasks.description: Refactor inefficient code, minimize HTTP requests, and optimize resource loading to improve overall application speed.
subtasks.details: Reduce unnecessary HTTP requests, bundle and compress JavaScript and CSS files, and remove redundant code. Implement lazy loading for non-critical resources.

tasks.title: Integrate Polar Payments with Minute-Based Credits
tasks.description: Implement Polar payment integration with a system for managing minute-based credits, including checkout, webhooks, balance display, and session gating.
tasks.details: To integrate Polar payments with minute-based credits, first, design a credit management system where 1 credit equals 60 minutes. Implement a checkout process that allows users to purchase credits via Polar. Set up webhooks to handle payment confirmations and update user balances accordingly. Display the current credit balance to users on their dashboard. Implement session gating to restrict access based on available credits, deducting credits as sessions are used. Ensure the backend schema supports transactions and credit management, and update APIs to handle credit operations.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify the checkout process by simulating a purchase and ensuring credits are added to the user's account. Test webhooks by sending mock payment confirmations and checking balance updates. Display the credit balance on the user dashboard and ensure it reflects the correct amount. Conduct a session and verify that credits are deducted appropriately. Ensure session gating prevents access when credits are insufficient.

subtasks.title: Design Convex Schema for Purchases and Credits Ledger
subtasks.description: Define and implement the backend Convex schema to support purchase records, a credits ledger, and user balances. Ensure the schema can track credit purchases, usage, and support transactional integrity.
subtasks.details: Create tables/collections for purchases, credits_ledger, and user balances. Ensure each purchase and credit transaction is recorded with necessary metadata for auditing and reconciliation.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify schema by creating, updating, and querying purchase and credit records. Ensure transactional consistency and correct balance calculations.

subtasks.title: Implement createCheckout API and Polar Checkout Link
subtasks.description: Develop an API endpoint to initiate Polar checkout sessions for purchasing minute-based credits. Integrate with Polar's SDK to generate checkout links tied to user accounts and selected credit packages.
subtasks.details: Use Polar's API to create checkout sessions, passing user identifiers and product IDs. Return the checkout URL to the frontend for user redirection.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test API by initiating checkouts and confirming correct link generation and user association.

subtasks.title: Set Up Webhook Handler for Payment Confirmation and Ledger Updates
subtasks.description: Configure a secure webhook endpoint to receive payment confirmation events from Polar. On successful payment, update the credits ledger and user balance accordingly.
subtasks.details: Implement webhook signature verification. On payment confirmation, record the purchase, update the credits ledger, and increment the user's available credits.
subtasks.testStrategy: Simulate webhook events from Polar and verify that user balances and ledger entries are updated accurately.

subtasks.title: Implement Credit Balance Query and UI Banner
subtasks.description: Develop backend and frontend logic to fetch and display the user's current credit balance. Show a prominent banner or indicator on the dashboard reflecting available minutes.
subtasks.details: Expose an API to retrieve the current credit balance. Update the frontend to display this information in real time, ensuring users are always aware of their available minutes.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check that the balance display updates immediately after purchases and credit usage.

subtasks.title: Develop Session Minute Reservation and Finalization Logic
subtasks.description: Implement logic to reserve and deduct credits as sessions are started and completed. Ensure credits are only deducted for actual session usage and handle edge cases such as session cancellation.
subtasks.details: On session start, reserve the required number of credits. On session end, finalize the deduction based on actual minutes used, updating the credits ledger and user balance.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run session simulations to verify correct credit reservation, deduction, and rollback on cancellation.

subtasks.title: Create Basic Admin Audit View for Purchases and Credits
subtasks.description: Build an admin interface to audit all purchases, credits ledger entries, and user balances. Provide filters and search to review transactions and investigate discrepancies.
subtasks.details: Display a list of all purchases and ledger entries with relevant metadata. Allow admins to search by user, date, or transaction type.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that all transactions are visible, searchable, and accurately reflect the underlying data.

tasks.title: Codify Shadcn/Tailwind Theme Tokens for Brutalist UI
tasks.description: Define and implement theme tokens for a minimalistic 'brutalist' UI using Shadcn and Tailwind in the packages/ui directory, and integrate them into the apps/app.
tasks.details: Begin by researching the characteristics of a 'brutalist' UI to inform the design of theme tokens. Define a color palette that reflects the brutalist aesthetic, focusing on stark contrasts and minimalistic colors. Establish a typography scale that emphasizes bold, utilitarian fonts. Set up design tokens for border radius, border styles, spacing, and focus outlines to maintain consistency across the UI. Implement these tokens in the packages/ui directory using Tailwind's configuration files. Ensure that these tokens are wired into the apps/app, allowing for consistent styling across the application. Consider using Tailwind's theme extension capabilities to customize the default theme with these new tokens.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify the implementation by creating sample components in the apps/app that utilize the new theme tokens. Check that the color palette, typography, and other design tokens are applied correctly and consistently. Conduct visual regression testing to ensure that the UI maintains a cohesive brutalist style. Test the responsiveness of the UI to ensure that the design tokens work well on different screen sizes. Additionally, review the Tailwind configuration files to confirm that the tokens are defined and integrated correctly.

subtasks.testStrategy: Create a sample Tailwind component in packages/ui to verify that the theme tokens are applied correctly.

subtasks.testStrategy: Check that the CSS variables are correctly exported and consumed in the apps/app by inspecting the styles of various components.

subtasks.title: Audit and Apply Theme Tokens to Core Components
subtasks.description: Audit core components such as buttons, inputs, and dialogs to ensure they utilize the newly defined theme tokens.
subtasks.details: Review the core components in the apps/app to identify areas where the new theme tokens can be applied. Update the component styles to use the tokenized CSS variables for colors, typography, spacing, and other design elements. Ensure that the components reflect the brutalist aesthetic consistently.
subtasks.testStrategy: Conduct visual regression testing on the core components to ensure they adhere to the brutalist design and that the theme tokens are applied consistently.
